favourite.article: We have a marriage that's anchored in the Saviors love. Love that hymn. Thanks so much for sharing.
So inspiring and a good food for the soul, Christ is solid rock and anchor.
It is so sweet to know that Jesus that is that anchor that keeps. it is so reassuring and a blessing to me.
I feel so blessed to have Jesus Christ as my anchor. He is always there when the storms of life threaten.
We have anchor that keeps the soul...🎼🎹🎶
By faith we can stand in the amid every storm and proclaim the Jesus is Lord!

Indeed The Lord is mighty and what can separate us from His love? Not life battles nor disappointments. He will bear is in His victorious right hand and lead us into righteousness. The Name of the Lord is a strong tower. In Him I am safe. I bless You for You're my anchor.
My anchor and hopes will firmly hold and I am secured because I have Christ. All my storms is over in my office and home.
This song is so uplifting and keeps me Focused. Thank God for the life of the Composer.
The world is fast changing, we thank God. We have an anchor in Christ. Nothing is guaranteed except God.
I know for sure that the Storm is over in my life. Jesus Christ is Lord
The Lord is my ANCHOR.
This hymn reminds me that my storm in this life will end today. By faith and as I type this it is over. Jesus did it on the sea immediately the storm obeyed. He is still doing it up till today.

Christ is indeed my anchor. He has firmly held me through the storms of my life, patiently waiting for things to calm and for me to come home even when I've sought to drift away from Him. But for Him I couldn't have made it through that trying 6-year period of my life during which I lost my parents and two elder siblings one after the other. Thank You Jesus for Your mercy and love. My anchor You always will be. Thank You!

I have been through some terrible storm of life; death of my sister, death of my father, painful divorce, but I thank God that all through it am still firm on my feet raising His banner and letting his glory be seen, you too can stand, I thank you Lord for being my anchor. in Jesus name amen.
Will YOUR anchor hold through the storm of life?

Our assurance as wee boys in the Lifebouys and Boys Brigade in the 1950's and 1960's. This wonderful song uplifted and gave us strength to always do our best as we walk with God. As I continue to move nearer to my harbour, my anchor grows stronger and my trust in the Lord remains steadfast and sure. God bless all who are in need of God's anchor.
I am blessed to have our LORD as my anchor! He is my rock, my constant, my anchor through the storms of life. Glory to His Name!

Thank You Jesus, our anchor cannot fail while our hopes abide in the Almighty God. Though the tempest rave and wild winds blow, not an angry wave shall overcome us in Jesus Name. Praise the Lord! Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Peace!!!
This is my song, ever reminding that God is my anchor till the close of time.
I was in the 1st Hetton-le-Hole B.B in 1954 & this Hynm was sung every Sunday afternoon it has been a strength ever since...
He's an anchor that is worth holding unto. No matter what trial you face, He will always be there to see you through.
I am in the 3rd glenrothes boys brigade and this hymn means a lot to me.
My day is never complete with this song. The words in it are tells us we can never make it in life without our Lord Jesus Christ. Indeed without Christ life is full of crises.
Thank You Jesus! May You always be my anchor.

The last stanza (from my Billy Graham Crusade songbook 1967): Will your eyes behold through the morning light The City of gold and the harbour bright Will you anchor safe by the heav'nly shore When life's storms are passed forever more.
Great hymnal inspiring God's in this last generation.
Great inspiring song.
Really re-assuring.

My best and most inspiring Christian hymn that I enjoyed from my high school days at the Methodist College, Uzuakoli, Nigeria, in the late 1960s. I still hum it and was pleasantly surprised it is online. Keep up the good work!
Very comforting and assuring song. Truly, the Savior's ''love '"is complete when all storms of life shall be over and never to appear again. Thanks for uploading this piece of song.
Truly blessed from this song...
Reading Job 14:7 this week and the chorus of this song came into mind. It's wonderful how deep the words of this song can penetrate a believer's heart and the peace it fills it.
This is the song that makes us to remember that always we can not do anything without Christ.
This is a reviving song indeed.
Indeed! This song is reassuring.
Amen!
What an assurance!!! Praise His holy name. Amen.
Amen. My favourite.
I like this.

Praise God for His grace, mercy and love, that anchors me in the storms of life. This song was a comfort to me. Re-assuring me that Jesus Christ is my anchor. Thanks for your upload so that I could locate the lyrics.

Thank You Jesus, our anchor cannot fail while our hopes abide within the veil. Though the tempest rave and wild winds blow, not an angry wave shall overcome us in Jesus Name. Praise the Lord! Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!!!

I praise the Lord for this song which causes me to remember it is His faithfulness which has been demonstrated in my life. Which has given to me hope, comfort and assurance that my life is in HIS hands. He loves me. Romans 8 :28 & 29...
This hymn has stood the test of time and will stand the challenges of all our tomorrows.
In the world that is full of challenges, Jesus Christ is the only sure anchor that can upholds to eternity. May God give us the anointing to abide in Him forever. Ameni
I so much love this song back in the days in the seminary school (Wesley seminary Ndoro) Nigeria. I pray God make me raptureable.
Thank You for this hymn, Lord. It is truly inspiring. I can't stop singing it.
This song reassures me; ultimately all is well because I am anchored to The Rock.
Woke up humming the song and went to look up the words. Singing it all day.
Love the song!! Inspirational.
This song ministered and uplifted me today. Thank You Lord.
I love this hymn so much.
Wil your anchor hold?.......grounded firm and deep in the Saviour's love.
Very inspiring indeed.
Yes we have anchor.

Thank God that I found this website. I've been humming this tune for decades—ever since I left high school in Ghana in the mid-1970s. I simply couldn't remember the lyrics (words of the song). I'm glad I've finally found it here. Thank You, God!

I am so glad to see so many Ghanaians here looking these hymns up. Remember singing them in school back home. Ghanaians we need to thank God for the blessing of God on our lives that we were brought up by the hands of God. God bless everyone on this website through His Son and my Saviour Jesus Christ. He is coming back soon and we would all sing these songs irrespective of where we are from. One that day we would be heavenians. Halleluyah.

Omg! Just what I needed!!!I Sing this song any time I'm down trodden and almost every morning before I begin my day...it's so encouraging..Love my Ultimate Anchor☝...God bless the writer of this wonderful hymn.
This Hymn came to my mind, when the ship I was on board was at anchor during a typhoon off Japan, and saw another ship dragging its anchor. It brought me closer to the Lord.
This song is so inspirational.
Thank God I have got the lyrics of this hymn online, may God bless the writer wherever he/she is. May God continue to be my anchor in all storms of life.
Hey, verses 2-4 are totally different from the original!
A song that will take you to the seventh heavens.
inspiring hymn
Powerful words; inspiring and giving hope to the weary.
Oh Lord let our anchor hold in the storms of life in Jesus Name. Let our hopes continue to abide in you in Jesus Name. Thank you for uploading this song.
Our lovely Sch anthem in Methodist Boys' High Sch, Oron. Very reflective and inspiring song. I hv an anchor that always keep my Soul firm in Jesus Christ. Hola!!!

I'm so glad I found this song online, was having my bath this night and just wondering about all the different issues we have in this dark world and just how to cope and the Holy Spirit reminded me of this song. I'm is so filled with joy that the Lord is always with us at every point of every storm in our life. Reminds me of the Boy's Brigade days. Thank You Lord.
Great hymn, what a Father who is always there for me. My heart will always be at rest in Him.

This one song that has so much helped my move through the storms and tides and strifes of this life. in the year 1998, I was declared a failure in my national diploma course, but sang and prayed this song for almost the whole of a year then God Almighty Himself turned the tides calmed the entire storm till I graduated with an award in the year 2000. it will forever be my song be there strifes and storms or not! I really know I have an ancor in this unyielding and ever living Father.
I really love this song, my faith in the Lord gets strengthened any time I listen to the song.
God, I am trusting You to hold me through this storm and see me through until I reach You and Your new world prepared for me! I love You.
A man without understanding of life is like a boat without an anchor.
Am soon speechless whenever I listen to it. Is great.
The blessed assurance of our faith in Christ Jesus.

It will surely hold in the floods of death, When the waters cold chill our latest breath; On the rising tide it can never fail, While our hopes abide within the veil. God richly bless the writer of this hymn. It's really inspiring. It keeps you going and making you build strong faith in God whenever you see yourself with nobody at your help, it tells you God is in control.
Listening to this song makes me believe it is well with my soul.

This hymn is ever-relevant and the message is so profound it will bless the most hurting of us mortals! As we go through rough patches in this journey called "life," we need to be reassured that Jesus is still in charge of our affairs "For we have not a High Priest Who cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities...." Heb 4:15 He is the Rock that cannot move and therefore we can boldly say 'We have an anchor that keeps the soul!'

I am currently experiencing some challenges in my life and needed to be reassured that God is still in control. This song speaks to my situation, I am being reminded that Jesus is my anchor which keeps the soul. The words are very profound and I am persuaded that God will come through when He sees it necessary.

Whenever it seems that things are spinning out of control in your life, take out time and meditate on the words of this hymn and also read Hebrews 6:13-20. This hymn reminds me of the good old days at the UNN Christ Chapel during the early 1980s, when we used to sing it quite often. It was most favorite hymn for our then Chaplain, Rev Cyril Anyanwu, who later became Bishop Mbaise Anglican Diocese. Each time I sing or hear this hymn sung it reminds me of the ever-smiling face of that humble and dedicated servant of God, who is now of the blessed memories.
Only the anchors grounded in Christ will hold, may God give us the grace to remain steadfast in times of trials.

I get humbled anytime I hear this song. It reminds me of how far the Lord has raised me through my infancy. If He has brought me this far then He can take me that far. My Hope is indeed, anchored in Jesus.
I was reading Hebrews chapter 6 and wanted a song to help me remember the key points of the text. I chose the word "hold" for my search in my hymnal and found this song.
This songs serves as a source of hope and inspiration. I wish the whole world could pause and sing it out out loud, spreading the hope. Praise God, Allelujah.
Every time I sing this hymn it stirs my spirit up. I wonder why we don't sing so many hymns in our worship services these days.

One of my all time favourites, belted out over many years as a boys brigadier in Sheffield, England. Whenever I hear it or sing it to myself, it reminds me of the world 50 odd years ago and my Methodist upbringing which despite a career in business held me fast to values and principles that still endure.
The Lord has just reminded me of this song...going through a challenging time and so I needed to be reminded of the words.

This is the song that always keeps me to my feet. It always prompts me that there will always be light at the end of the tunnel. Its also the Anthem of the Boys Brigade and forever makes me feel like a soldier whenever we sing at any gathering.

This wonderful song was the class song of the Mariner Class of 1963 at Asbury University, Wilmore, Kentucky. In June we will have our 50th reunion and all sing the song together, probably with tears running down our cheeks! The song has reminded me of my true Anchor and I have been held firm in His love for 71 years.
The hymn is my testimony in the year 2012. It's a great and wonderful hymn of encouragement.
Most inspiring! It stirs up wonderful memories too.Thank God from whom all blessings flow.
This great hymn is the School Hymn of Methodist Boys High School, Oron, Akwa Ibom State, Nigeria. It is an Inspiring hymn to all MBHS old Boys/Girls, and humanity.

God has revived me thru this song, I am strong in the midst of weaknesses. I take this opportunity to encourage my brothers and sisters in the faith to hold on fast to Jesus. Peace and grace to you all.
This hymn helps me to move on in all life's challenges I am faced with. Thank you.

Am glad to found this song again. I needed it at a time like this. Can't remember the wording then I search for it; lo and behold it pop up. Thank you all for a great job. May the good Lord bless you the more.
I had known this song since I was little, can remember age precisely, just lately I remembered again a browse through. Thanks for making it available here.

I am 25 years old. My mother taught me this song 21 years ago, when I was only 4. All through my life whenever I'm faced with difficulty, this song comes to mine. I bless the Lord for the composer of this song. It has lived in me all through my whole life!! Truly, we have an anchor!!!

I bless the Lord for the composer of this great song. I first heard it at a branch of my church, Assemblies of God Church and just about a year later when I had issues with my relationship, the Lord brought the song back to my memory. I looked it up on the net and found it. My life has never remained the same afterwards. I call up the song each time I am weary and I get inspiration. Praise the Lord!

In my Christian life, nothing has been worthy than being at the feet of Christ and listening from Him speak to me through hymns songs. This song has been my best renditions in my Christian journey to heaven. Having lost all my parents at an early age, the church became my parent. When I got converted into ths new family, I heard ths song first. It keeps giving me hope of a new heaven and a new earth where there will be no pain, death or hunger. May our lives be a testimony unto others. Amen!
Spirit filled and soul inspiring hymn.
an inspirational song of all standards.

I came across this hymn on a CD "Men of Faith: Mandate". It's from a men's conference in Belfast led by Robin Mark. I was so inspired by it.....and it was new hymn to me!! Thank you for this site that provides the guitar chords.
God bless you for making this God's anointed hymn available. It is a great blessing to me.

This song has always been a source of inspiration to me since I learnt it 34 years ago. I came to this site today looking for the lyrics to be used in our first service in February. Thank God for the life of the composer and the brethren that has made it freely available. God bless you all.

I am a Methodist from Hastings E Sussex and have lived in Zambia since 1965. On my small holding we have a project for needy kids and their families. The children in the neighbourhood come to have lessons in literacy and have a high protein meal 6 days a week. We start with an assembly where they sing and learn poems and rhymes. This hymn is one of their favourites and they play tambourines when the sing the chorus.
Hilary, from Leeds. Don't give up. I am a leader of a Boys Brigade group in New Zealand, and there has been a resurgence of interest in Boys Brigade recently. Keep praying for our youth!

I learnt this song at elementary school. The song lifts my spirit any time I am down and I see challenges in front of me. It has been such an inspirational song for me and as a committed Methodist, I enjoy singing it with my own voice.

We are singing this at my mum's funeral on Wednesday 17th August. She was 90 years of age. This song was chosen by my two sons were boys brigade members for many years. We used to watch them march through the streets in their uniforms, what a wonderful sight and sound it was. No more I fear what a loss to the youth of today.

The Lord gave me a very precious gift a Loving Mother and Father who taught me the values of a Christian faith, through not just going to Church but the way they led their life, This Hymn reminds me of my parents especially at the end of their lives, their faith never once swayed. My dear Mother was promoted to glory on the 20 June with all her family around her as she peacefully slipped out of this mortal life for the Angels take her home, What a gift knowing the journey we are on, None of us know what twist and turns await us, happy or sad, easy of trying, but we do know that with the love of God he will hold us as a Father dose in his strong arms and keep us from stumbling.

I first learned this song at a boys school (Methodist ) in 1970s. In my local church we still sing this inspiration song. It always lifted my faith in the Lord when I sing or listen to it. Beside the word of God, whenever I face challenges in life it helps me.The truth is that victory has been won already for us. What is left is our faith to hook on Christ whenever challenges of this world face us. No matter how big the challenge may be, this song will tell you that you are a winner. If only you Still remain in Christ Jesus.

This morning devotion, the staff who lead the prayers raised this song at this critical moment of our organization. The song has lifted my faith in God and hope He will save my organization from sinking including the staff. I am weeping as I write this comment. God is in control. Amen. Please readers pray for me and my organization. We are Christians and work for a Christian organization.

The tune of this great hymn of the Church of Jesus has been ringing in my soul the last three days; it so intense and so real I started singing it during corporate prayer in our Friday night service at New Covenant Church International, Providence, RI. I visited this site today hoping to get the words of all the stanzas for use in Sunday AM service. Thanks to God for both the composer and those who labored to make available on the net. I am truly grateful. Bishop Q.
I learnt this tune in the Girls' Brigade. Now after 40 years, I can still remember how the Boys' Brigade sang it. The song sung with so much gusto remain in my memory to this day.

I agree with Jack and Margaret, I'm an officer in the Boys' Brigade and can't help but be uplifted whenever this is sung at Display or Enrolement services. The Motto Sure and Steadfast and this song both draw their inspiration from the KJV Bible, Hebrews 6:19.

This hymn is/was widely sung by the Boys' Brigade whose motto "Sure and Stedfast" comes from its powerful lyrics. There is nothing like hearing it sung by a throng of men and boys, with spirits lifted by the words and music.
This is an inspiration that is necessary for the soul. I have looked for this song for year and thanks to google, I have it now. It's words are so reasuring that one can win a war after singing it.

Sadly this wonderful old hymn is not in many modern hymn books - I'm taking the service at an Aged Care home tomorrow and I am following the lectionary for my message - This is the tune I have been humming and fits the "End Times" message so well in this very uncertain world that we live in.

Nice vigorous tempo on the sound file. I had just remarked to my wife that this hymn is such a virile piece of music, and now I see that the lyric was written by a woman! Well, praise the Lord! It's still a virile piece of Christian music!
Just discovered hymnal.net and have been feasting on this blessed treasure of His Body-hymns; old and new. God bless you all.
